NM_image class¶

class NM_image.NM_image¶

Abstract base class. Sub-classes of this are classes to generate different types of plots E.g. a class called gen_dispersion

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

_integrate_mode(n, l, omega)¶

Some method for integration if it is required - probably hijack this from Terrys code, though this may not be needed :type n: int :param n: The n value that will integrated

Parameters

  • l (int) – The l value that will integrated

  • omega (float) – Eigenperiod of the normal mode [mHz]

abstract _load_data()¶

Loads data required for plotting from relevant text files

_prepare_plot()¶

Conducts pre-processing of data, including loading and any integration/other processing required

abstract _produce_plot()¶

The actual plotting step for static images - should return fig and axis to the plot function.

abstract init_anim_data()¶

Initialises/creates matplotlib artists (e.g. a 2DLine object) as part of animations see - _gen_animations() in ps_figure.py

make()¶

Function is the driver for plotting - accessed by main codes. This incorporates any loading of the data and processing (e.g. integration). Then runs the make_plot function to actually make the plot

abstract update_anim_data(iteration)¶

Function is used to update MPL artists (e.g. a 2DLine object) as part of animations for given iteration value see _gen_animations() in ps_figure.py

Parameters

iteration (int) – Iteration step for animations

Subclasses of NM_image:

  • Radial 2D plot class
  • Dispersion plot class
  • 3D Animation class
